snippet: Mr. Zafrani’s documentary about disabled children, “The Other Dreamers,” has played dozens of festivals but was turned downed by the Human Rights Human Wrongs festival.
abstract: Organizers of Norwegian film festival Human Rights Human Wrongs cite support for academic and cultural boycott of Israel and Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions movement as reason for rejecting Israeli director Roy Zafrani's short documentary The Other Dreamers;  Palestinian activist Omar Barghouti, who founded BDS movement, says campaign, which has been erratically interpreted by supporters around world, only calls for boycott of institutions complicit in Israel's violation of international law, not individuals.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Zafrani’s documentary about disabled children, “The Other Dreamers,” has played dozens of festivals but was turned downed by the Human Rights Human Wrongs festival.

headline.main: Festival in Oslo Rejects Film by Roy Zafrani, Citing Cultural Boycott of Israel
headline.print_headline: Oslo Festival Rejects Documentary, Citing Cultural Boycott Against Israel

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
